description: Triangle T(n,k) (n >= 1, k >= 1) giving dimension of bigrading of Connes-Moscovici noncocommutative algebra.
comments: With rows reversed, T(n,k) appears to be the number of partitions of n with k big parts, where a big part is a part >=2 (0<=k<=n/2). For example, with n=4, the 3 partitions 4, 31, 211 each have one big part. [David Callan, Aug 23 2011]
links: D. J. Broadhurst and D. Kreimer, Towards cohomology of renormalization...
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := Count[ IntegerPartitions[n], pp_ /; Count[pp, p_ /; p >= 2] == k]; Flatten[ Table[ t[n, k], {n, 1, 14}, {k, n-1, 0, -1} ] ] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jan 23 2012, after David Callan *)
author: _David Broadhurst_, Feb 05 2000
